title: How to Create a Bedspring Vase

methods.name: Choosing a Suitable Bedspring and Base

steps.headline: Select a base of your choice.
steps.description: This can be a tin can's base, a round piece of metal etc. It is important to know what to choose as if affects the appearance of the work a lot because you can see the base.

steps.headline: Search for a bedspring with a design of your choice.
steps.description: It can be rusty or smooth depending on the effect when you use it on your flowers. The size of the bedspring is also very significant. Make sure it fits your base exactly. Make sure that it is suitable for flower also and is high or short enough. It's great if you could find a bedspring where it has equal circles so once you put in your flowers, they won't fall out but an uneven one looks better aesthetically.

steps.headline: Choose your soldering equipment for this project.
steps.description: It will be needed to stick the base to the spring. Don't forget about your gloves and safety goggles.

steps.headline: Clean your bedspring.
steps.description: This helps the bedspring to be spray painted easier. Dust it with a brush or something light to remove the dirt.

steps.headline: By using pliers, you can shape the  bed springs dramatically to the desired shape.
steps.description: Do it carefully because the springs might snap.

steps.headline: By using the pliers again, round the bend at the end of the bed spring's tip if desired so it's smooth.
steps.description: Instead, you can also sand the tip of the rough edge. Do this to the side where the base if not going to stick to.

steps.headline: Grab your selected base.
steps.description: For now, we will use a simple round metal piece with a lifted rim. If you want, you can use a strong scissor across the can (at least 1 inch will do in height). You could also get a strong metal piece and cut it then bend it so the edges are there. Another option is plastic etc. just cut it into the desired size and super glue or solder another plastic rim around it. The edge or rim is needed so when you put the flowers in, the flowers won't fall out. If you want, you can remove it's rust, spray paint and primer it on a large work space. Do the same thing to the bed spring. Color it with any color as desired. Don't forget to let them dry. You can spray paint it multiple times with different colors so each spring is a different color.

steps.headline: Place your base and your bedspring (so that the larger spring is facing up-wards)) on a large surface in a garage etc.
Solder the base to the bedspring's whole rim.
steps.description: Ensure that you wear your safety equipment such as your safety goggles and safety gloves.

steps.headline: Decorate your vase's interior's base with glitter or stickers.
steps.description: Make sure it matches the theme of your vase. You can also tie a delicate ribbon on one of the rims of the spring so it looks like a bow.

steps.headline: Add in your flowers to see if it works.
steps.description: Place it in the place you want it to go which should be at a desk. Its rim will cover the end of each flower's stem.

steps.headline: Select you flowers.
steps.description: They should be fake ones made of plastic. Choose flowers that matches the project via contrast. For example, I painted the bedspring black and the base so I'll add in white flowers.

text: Choosing a Suitable Bedspring and Base Select a base of your choice. This can be a tin can's base, a round piece of metal etc. It is important to know what to choose as if affects the appearance of the work a lot because you can see the base. Search for a bedspring with a design of your choice. It can be rusty or smooth depending on the effect when you use it on your flowers. The size of the bedspring is also very significant. Make sure it fits your base exactly. Make sure that it is suitable for flower also and is high or short enough. It's great if you could find a bedspring where it has equal circles so once you put in your flowers, they won't fall out but an uneven one looks better aesthetically. Choose your soldering equipment for this project. It will be needed to stick the base to the spring. Don't forget about your gloves and safety goggles. Preparing Your Bedspring and Base Clean your bedspring. This helps the bedspring to be spray painted easier. Dust it with a brush or something light to remove the dirt. By using pliers, you can shape the  bed springs dramatically to the desired shape. Do it carefully because the springs might snap. By using the pliers again, round the bend at the end of the bed spring's tip if desired so it's smooth. Instead, you can also sand the tip of the rough edge. Do this to the side where the base if not going to stick to. Grab your selected base. For now, we will use a simple round metal piece with a lifted rim. If you want, you can use a strong scissor across the can (at least 1 inch will do in height). You could also get a strong metal piece and cut it then bend it so the edges are there. Another option is plastic etc. just cut it into the desired size and super glue or solder another plastic rim around it. The edge or rim is needed so when you put the flowers in, the flowers won't fall out. If you want, you can remove it's rust, spray paint and primer it on a large work space. Do the same thing to the bed spring. Color it with any color as desired. Don't forget to let them dry. You can spray paint it multiple times with different colors so each spring is a different color. Create Your Holder Place your base and your bedspring (so that the larger spring is facing up-wards)) on a large surface in a garage etc. to perform soldering. Solder the base to the bedspring's whole rim. Ensure that you wear your safety equipment such as your safety goggles and safety gloves. Decorate your vase's interior's base with glitter or stickers. Make sure it matches the theme of your vase. You can also tie a delicate ribbon on one of the rims of the spring so it looks like a bow. Add in your flowers to see if it works. Place it in the place you want it to go which should be at a desk. Its rim will cover the end of each flower's stem. Select you flowers. They should be fake ones made of plastic. Choose flowers that matches the project via contrast. For example, I painted the bedspring black and the base so I'll add in white flowers. Finished. Enjoy your work of art!
